author: Mike Glenn, Houston Chronicle
title: Liberty County constable struck while directing traffic
text:
By Mike Glenn , Houston Chronicle Updated 9:28 pm, Wednesday, February 15, 2017 Photo: David Taylor Justin Johnston being sworn in as Constable Pct. 1 for Liberty County. Johnston was struck by a truck near Dayton on Wednesday around 5:15 p.m. As of Wednesday night, he remains in critical condition at Memorial Hermann Hospital. Justin Johnston being sworn in as Constable Pct. 1 for Liberty... 
Liberty County Precinct 1 Constable Justin Johnston remains hospitalized at the Texas Medical Center after he was struck by a truck near Dayton, officials confirmed Wednesday. 
Johnston was hit about 5:15 p.m. Wednesday while he was helping to directing afternoon rush-hour traffic along a stretch of State Highway 146 north of Mont Belvieu, troops with the Texas Department of Public Safety said. 
Investigators said a man in a pickup truck tried to avoid the backed-up traffic by driving along the southbound shoulder. The driver crashed through a traffic barricade and struck a Liberty County Sheriff's Office patrol car. 
The pickup then hit Johnston, DPS troopers said. 
Johnston and the driver of the pickup, identified as Samuel Leyva, 39, were flown by Life Flight helicopter to Memorial Hermann Hospital. 
DPS officials said Johnston was in critical condition while Leyva, a Cleveland resident, was in serious condition. 
The driver's 8-year-old daughter had minor injuries and was flown with her father to the Texas Medical Center, officials said. 
A sample of Leyva's blood will be taken at the hospital to determine if he was impaired at the time of the crash, officials said. 
The investigation into the crash is continuing, officials said. Subscribe to HCN
